revision.text: {{Talk header}} {{WikiProjectBannerShell|1= {{WikiProject Cold War|class=a|importance=mid}} {{WikiProject Southeast Asia|class=a|importance=mid}} {{WikiProject Vietnam|class=A|importance=mid}} {{WPMILHIST|A-Class=pass|old-peer-review=yes|class=A|Aviation-task-force=yes|Southeast-Asian-task-force=yes|US-task-force=yes}}}} {{OnThisDay|date1=2011-02-08|oldid1=412635401|date2=2013-03-25|oldid2=546685970}} {{Backwardscopy |author = Miller, F. P., Vandome, A. F., & McBrewster, J. |year = 2009 |title = Easter offensive: Operation Lam Son 719, Battle of An Lộc, Battle of Kontum, Operation Linebacker, Paris Peace Accords, Vietnam People's Army, North Vietnam, Tet offensive, An Lộc, Communist Party of Vietnam |org = Alphascript Publishing |comments = {{OCLC|666514020}}, ISBN 9786130077808. |bot=LivingBot }} ==Edit request from Alanwbaker, 5 August 2010== {{tn|editsemiprotected}} The following sentence is partially correct. "As a response, a completely new airstrip had to be built and the first aircraft arrived on 15 February.[33]" According to the declassified Project CHECO (Contemporary Historical Examination of Current Operations Report) Tactical Airlift in SEA, 15 Feb 72, by Major Ronald D. Merrell: "On 4 February the new 3,200 foot runway was completed and the first C-130 landed. It was apparent that the dirt strip was too soft when the wheels of the lightly loaded aircraft sank into the surface more than six inches. Consequently, engineers covered the runway with aluminum matting, completing the work on 15 February. The first POL sortie arrived the same day." [[User:Alanwbaker|Alanwbaker]] ([[User talk:Alanwbaker|talk]]) 03:08, 5 August 2010 (UTC) :{{xt|This template may only be used when followed by a specific description of the request, that is, specific text that should be removed and a verbatim copy of the text that should replace it. "Please change X" is not acceptable and will be rejected; the request must be of the form "please change X to Y"}} :So - no offence - but please make an actual specific suggested improvement. And use another{{tn|editsemiprotected}}. Thanks, [[User:Chzz|''' Chzz ''']][[User talk:Chzz| ► ]] 03:10, 6 August 2010 (UTC) {{notdone}} ==Edit request from Alanwbaker, 10 August 2010== {{tlx|editsemiprotected}} '''Please change:''' "As a response, a completely new airstrip had to be built and the first aircraft arrived on 15 February.[33]" '''to:''' "As a response, a completely new 3200' dirt airstrip was built. On 4 February the first C-130 landed there bringing in an Air Force Combat Control Team. The wheels of the lightly loaded aircraft sank into the surface more than six inches, making it clear that the airstrip could not handle heavily-loaded aircraft. Engineers covered the runway with aluminum matting, completing the work on 15 February. The same day the first operational C-130 sortie arrived, bringing in fuel for helicopters." '''Source:''' Project CHECO (Contemporary Historical Examination of Current Operations Report) Tactical Airlift in SEA, 15 Feb 72, by Major Ronald D. Merrell. Available online at http://www.vietnam.ttu.edu/star/images/039/0390203001a.pdf [[User:Alanwbaker|Alanwbaker]] ([[User talk:Alanwbaker|talk]]) 15:51, 10 August 2010 (UTC) :Welcome. Can I suggest that you make a few (5 more) minor edits so that you become autoconfirmed and then make this change yourself? I would have a hard time justifying the requested level of detail about the runway in the middle of that high level summary. A simple change from "first aircraft" to "first fully-loaded aircraft" would seem more appropriate to me. [[User:Celestra|Celestra]] ([[User talk:Celestra|talk]]) 17:23, 10 August 2010 (UTC) ::[[File:Red information icon with gradient background.svg|20px|link=|alt=]] '''Not done:''' No consensus to make the change right now. Feel free to make the request again if the consensus changes. [[User:Dabomb87|Dabomb87]] ([[User talk:Dabomb87|talk]]) 00:50, 11 August 2010 (UTC) ==Edit request from Oschlag, 27 January 2011== {{tld|edit semi-protected}} URL in "External links" to "Lam Son 719 at 101st Aviation Battalion site" is dead. New correct URL is: http://www.comanchero.org/LamSon719.html [[User:Oschlag|Oschlag]] ([[User talk:Oschlag|talk]]) 12:34, 27 January 2011 (UTC) :{{done}} →♠[[User:Gfoley4|Gƒoley]]↔[[User talk:Gfoley4|Four]]♣← 01:28, 28 January 2011 (UTC) == Viet Cong == Under "Background" the article states "the National Front for the Liberation of South Vietnam (NLF or derogatively, Viet Cong)". I believe that "derogatively" is entirely the wrong word. I don't believe that "Viet Cong" was used in a derogative way at all: I thnk the word should be "commonly" (actually I thought of a better word about 2am but I've forgotten it). — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Baska436|Baska436]] ([[User talk:Baska436|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Baska436|contribs]]) 03:48, 26 March 2013 (UTC) Bernard Fall in "Street Without Joy" says that the term Viet Cong was a pejorative term used for the enemy by our forces. In our Area of Operations, Quang Tri Province Northern I Corps, when I was there '69–'70, "Viet Cong" or "VC" was the name in standard use by our side for partisans in the south. Whereas the regular forces form the north (our primary enemy there and then) were referred to as the "NVA", and they were feared and respected. The Vietnamese people were generally called "gooks" even by the officers, treated with contempt and looked down on generally, though not universally. — Preceding [[Wikipedia:Signatures|unsigned]] comment added by [[User:Tonygumbrell|Tonygumbrell]] ([[User talk:Tonygumbrell|talk]] • [[Special:Contributions/Tonygumbrell|contribs]]) 18:07, 19 May 2015 (UTC) == Prior ops against the Trail == See alsos or other linkage to prior offensives against the Trail would round out the historical picture. I have in mind links to [[Operation Junction City Jr.]], [[Operation Left Jab]], [[Operation Diamond Arrow]], and [[Operation Honorable Dragon]] at present. To be written in the near future are the [[Tchepone Operation]], [[Operation Maeng Da]], and several others. In other words, there were a number of strikes against Tchepone and the Trail that are not generally known, even if they are part of the history.[[User:Georgejdorner|Georgejdorner]] ([[User talk:Georgejdorner|talk]]) 23:51, 16 December 2015 (UTC) :Please add Infobox:military conflict for each new operation/battle page you create. [[User:Mztourist|Mztourist]] ([[User talk:Mztourist|talk]]) 03:34, 17 December 2015 (UTC)
